column5: We have a crew going into Northern Lights Lake on the Onatario/Minnesota border next month. Anyone know much about this lake and/or lodge?
Just got back from there last week. E-mail me at [email protected] and I'll be glad to help you out.

We have a group that goes there regularly and attempts trophy fish. They catch few but big, primarily after midnight trolling Rapalas. Lots of smallie action. I have been on this trip just once and do not care if I ever go back. Cabins = primative, noise (drunk campers) = high and not the fault of the lodge but water way down and had to push boats out 100+ ft before can drop motoer and go. Did I mention drunks? The trailer residents have alot of fun 24x7 it seems. But ignoring that fishing is OK. Smallies break the monotony between walleyes Be objective, you will like it. TLY
